Row.Text: I desire not to keep my place in this government an hour longer than I may preserve this nation in its just rights.
I am Oliver Cromwell. I am no King, but it is nonetheless by providence that I rule.
I am Oliver Cromwell. I am no King, but it is nonetheless by providence that I rule.
I am Oliver Cromwell. I am no King, but it is nonetheless by providence that I rule.
Weeds and nettles, briars and thorns, have thriven under your shadow. I will see you removed from your office.
I tell you: we will cut off your head with the crown still upon it.
No one rises so high as one who knows not where they are going.
It must be the Lord who guided your countenance thus. It is to him we both owe our thanks.
You have clearly bartered your conscience for bribes. Defile this sacred place no more.
